sense.gloss: one's early life, upbringing, personal history

sdata.j: |↑生↑↓お↓い↑立↑↓た↓ち|を↑知↑↓し↓らない↑人↑↓ひと↓にネイティブみたいに↑聞↑↓き↓こえるよって↑言↑↓い↓われたら、それはおそらく、あなたの↑喋↑↓しゃべ↓り↑方↑↓かた↓のどこかが、ネイティブじゃないと↑感↑↓かん↓じさせたってことだよ。つまりね、ネイティブのようには↑聞↑↓き↓こえないということなんだよ。
sdata.e: If someone who doesn't know your background says that you sound like a native speaker, it means they probably noticed something about your speaking that made them realize you weren't a native speaker. In other words, you don't really sound like a native speaker.
